block.p: Joking that ''rumors of my demise are greatly exaggerated,'' Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani said yesterday that he had not yet decided if he would stay in the race for United States Senate after his announcement that he was seeking a separation from his wife. That statement followed the mayor's disclosure that another woman was ''a very good friend.''

The turmoil surrounding the mayor's personal life has produced an undeclared shift in strategy by the Democratic candidate, Hillary Rodham Clinton, as her campaign maneuvers to adjust to what aides view as an unsettled period filled with opportunities and perils. Articles, Pages B1 and B4.
